GameItemType.Description: This chain helmet of sable links will establish a telepathic connection will all the surrounding crows, ravens, magpies, jays, rooks and jackdaws, allowing you to observe the world at large through their eyes. Unfortunately, the audio part of the enchantment appears to be defective, giving the disturbing impression of attending a wordless puppet show.

Donning this skullcap will stimulate the motor regions of the brain and enhance one's dexterity and speed. Too advanced for post-Cataclysm ears? Very well then, use this helm and you'll move faster and shoot better.

A strange contraption which greatly accelerates the faculties of the mind, this metallic coif is especially prized by Mages who can turn their magical talent into lethal brain power. And flaunt their superior intelligence as an added bonus.

GameModifier.Provides: Mind Blast- Does mental damage to 5 units in a line and knocks them prone

GameItemType.Description: This safety helmet must have belonged to a pre-Cataclysm engineer who worked in dangerous environments filled with elemental hazards. It appears to be in fairly good shape. You're now all set for a dig in some scalding volcanic mine.
Apparently it only takes a set a horns to boost one's self-confidence and send it soaring to unsuspected heights. Hook'em horns!

GameModifier.Provides: +10% cumulative damage with each successful attack

GameItemType.Description: This is the traditional leather bonnet used by Peasants all over Elemental. Whether they are oppressed serfs or local plutocrats, this is the symbol to unite them all in their most noble and degraded aspects. Best check it for lice before using it.

GameModifier.Provides: Safety in numbers- +6 Dodge when in an army of 5 or larger

GameItemType.Description: A crown to rule them all or at least a nifty ornament which will allow you to become that haughty, high and mighty ruler standing way above the rabble. Word to the wise sovereign: every once in a while, try to lose those superior airs and strive to remember who your friends are.

GameModifier.Provides: This unit receives double the normal Swarm bonus
Allows the owner to cast Cull the Weak

GameItemType.Description: Planning a hit-and-run robbery? Or maybe to double-cross and ambush your neighbors? Don't forget to wear your Marauder's Hood to the party.

GameModifier.Provides: +3 Moves for the first turn of combat
+10 to Critical Hit chance for the first turn of combat
+40% to Critical Hit damage for the first turn of combat

GameItemType.Description: Legendary gladiator Black Spike was said to be invincible in the arena, piling up victories and corpses, slaying champions and monsters alike with tireless and relentless determination. This helmet radiates glory galore and maybe you could claim some as you own?

GameModifier.Provides: 1.5% less damage from Physical attacks per Level
Collect three Black Spike items to inflict Dismantling Stroke- +400% Crushing Blow Attack

GameItemType.Description: The champion brave enough to don this helm will unavoidably become an instrument of chaos and destruction.

GameModifier.Provides: +3 Moves for the first turn of combat

GameItemType.Description: The symbol of past ruin and desolation, unforgivable sins and bloody massacres. This helmet still permeates hatred and savagery.

GameModifier.Provides: +20% Attack vs opponents of the opposite race (fallen vs men)

GameItemType.Description: This charmed helmet affects one's sense of self-preservation by giving its wearer a carefree attitude when facing combat situations. If you can abide such garish colors.
This enchanted wig greatly enhances one's powers of persuasion. While it is a rather grotesque piece of apparel, its magical components shield the wearer from the world's scrutiny.
A refined armor with an excellent ventilation design for those endless ceremonial marches.

The battle armor of the Wizards of yonder, packed with all the enchantments to keep those spells flowing in combat situations. The unbreakable chain links are so supple and comfortable, you could use this metallic skin as a sleeping garment.

GameModifier.Provides: +1 Spell Power for each point of Stamina
+2 Spell Mastery for each point of Stamina

GameItemType.Description: This ancient chitinous exoskeleton belonged to the soldier of a now extinct insectoid humanoid race. Twitching antennas, clacking mandibles and vibrating wings, you are now privy to the chorus of your insect brethren and boy do they have some recriminations to voice. Bzz bzz.

GameModifier.Provides: Spit Acid- Target enemy takes 2-6 damage a round for 15 rounds.
Allows the unit to cast Insect Plague

GameItemType.Description: This battleworn relic radiates intimacy with the legendary conflicts of the past as the permanent bloodstains dotting its surface would attest.
A blacksmith's apron which can double as armor, it is so resistant to heat you could take a swim in molten rock with it. Or maybe not.

GameModifier.Provides: Collect all three Tools of the Mastersmith to cast Forging Excellence- Army gains +6 Attack, +6 Critical Chance and +100% Critical Damage

GameItemType.Description: Copiously lathered with oil, this leather armor's lack of conductivity offers its wearer a certain protection from electrical attacks.
The true garment of the Warlords of the barbarian tribes, said to be animated by fierceness and bravery.

GameModifier.Provides: +4 Initiative for the first turn of combat

GameItemType.Description: These nefarious robes were once used by the maladjusted converts of the Lost Circle. Anyone tempted to wear one should know it will be interpreted as a declaration of war on Life.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows the wearer to cast Death Circle

GameItemType.Description: Legendary gladiator Black Spike was said to be invincible in the arena, piling up victories and corpses, slaying champions and monsters alike with tireless and relentless determination. His armor's aerodynamics were so perfectly designed that it was said to move of its own accord.

GameModifier.Provides: Collect three Black Spike items to inflict Dismantling Stroke- +400% Crushing Blow Attack

GameItemType.Description: Are you even worthy?

GameModifier.Provides: Saintly Aura- Adjacent friendly units regenerate 4 hit points per turn

GameItemType.Description: Armors which were worn by the shock troops of now extinct empires, these relics remain deeply rooted in the collective memory of Kingdom citizens as the stuff of nightmares.
Still craving for that extra boost? Well look no further than these enchanted robes which bestow awesome energy levels without the added weight of armor.

If your intent is to follow up on that contract and execute the unwilling nominee (despite our tearful entreatments), then you'll want to don this magical garment to increase your chance to score a successful hit.
Exactitude for a perfect aim is sought by all but only found by a handful. That's why the inaccurate majority is better off cheating.
Serving as a conduit to the universe's bottomless well of energies, this artifact can turn a meager apprentice into an invincible master.
A most venomous garment whose fibers have been magically bonded with naja poison.

GameModifier.Provides: Melee attacks do 6 Poison damage per round to the victim
Enemies that strike the wearer become infected with poison

GameItemType.Description: The mandatory uniform of the now defunct Convent of Blessed Brightness, this garment has been imbued with powerful enchantments.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows the wearer to cast Healing Light

GameItemType.Description: Ever heard the story of the Glitter Emperor who had the Gildar Touch? Well perhaps, just this once, one can affirm that fairy tales do have a basis in reality.

GameModifier.Provides: Gildar Touch Effect- The unit gains +1 Gold each time it strikes an enemy

GameItemType.Description: According to local folktales, these gloves were universally banned from archery tournaments after a squire aptly named Lester the Maladroit outplayed the undefeated champion Sharpeye Sharidon at the annual Harvest Fair. When the subterfuge was discovered, Lester, now designated as the Cheater, became the target of a cartload of rotten tomatoes.

GameModifier.Provides: Bull's Eye- +300% Attack when using a Bow but you lose your next turn
Heart of the Target- Ignores 20% of the victim's defense when using a Bow

GameItemType.Description: These tough yet malleable vambraces will provide complete protection for your arms and deflect any critical strikes aimed against them.

GameModifier.Provides: Unit has a 20% chance of resisting a Critical attack

GameItemType.Description: The enchantment bestowed upon these gloves will only allow access to the most virile of hands. You'd think they were conceived by a macho, macho Mage (he's got to be a macho Mage).

GameModifier.Provides: Crippling Blow- +100% Attack, but you lose your next action

GameItemType.Description: Once penance is served and absolution is found, restitution lies at the end of the journey.

GameModifier.Provides: Penitent's Restitution - Heals all allies and caster gains 3 hit points permanently (Requires 40 Penitent's Suffering charges)
Penitent's Suffering- Penance is served each time the wearer is struck in combat (+1 charge)

GameItemType.Description: Made of the toughest leather, these gauntlets are especially deadly in close combat.
Always useful in speeding convalescence towards full recovery, military scholars are still trying to rediscover how to mass produce these vambraces. Unsuccessfully so far.
These foul gloves have the texture of cold and moist skin. Anyone wearing them will feel sharp hunger pangs for blood.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows the wearer to cast Drain Life
Allows the wearer to cast Syphon Strength

GameItemType.Description: Now that you've got the viciously sharp claws, the only thing left is to get yourself in a catfight.

These torture devices were no doubt invented by the Quendar to boost the efficiency of those lazy and useless slaves. Although the idea of putting them on is revolting and degrading, they can be quite useful in increasing the production of your successful strikes. Who needs dignity in these times anyway?

GameModifier.Provides: +2 Accuracy for each point of Stamina

GameItemType.Description: Legendary gladiator Black Spike was said to be invincible in the arena, piling up victories and corpses, slaying champions and monsters alike with tireless and relentless determination. These spiny vambraces can still pack quite a punch.

GameModifier.Provides: BlackSpike's Power Punch- +50% Attack and the victim gets knocked back 2 tiles
Collect three Black Spike items to inflict Dismantling Stroke- +400% Crushing Blow Attack

GameItemType.Description: Cold hands, warm heart?

GameModifier.Provides: +10 Critical Chance vs enemies with less than 50 Cold Resistance

GameItemType.Description: These well preserved slacks probably belonged to a circus performer. Strong emotional vibes still cling to them: stage fright, exhilaration and the fierce pride that follows cheers and applause. Put them on and the show will go on!

The lower half of the uniform worn by the Convent of Blessed Brightness, this vestment preserves the physical integrity of its wearer, going so far as to regenerate missing tissue and turn the most severe injuries into nothing but a bad memory.

GameModifier.Provides: Wellspring- All allies heal 24 hit points (+4 per life shard)

GameItemType.Description: The purpose of these Stygian restraints is to mystically anchor higher demons visiting the material plane, helping their global minds focus on a far smaller scale. Mortals lucky enough to have a pair fall in their laps can also wear them for a devilish thrill or two. What a clich, eh?

These greaves may look antiquated and probably won't garner the admiration of your fellow soldiers but the excellence of their craftsmanship cannot be disputed. You won't be able to find such quality in marketplaces nowadays.
The under-the-belt counterparts to the Naja Skin gauntlets, these greaves provide protection and serpentine accuracy.
No really, these look good on you. Get ready for some roaring good time!
A snaky hose to mesmerize those inclined to the serpentine, to ooze around those prone to violence and to deflect those vicious ill-advised effects.

GameModifier.Provides: Naja Dancer- +2 Dodge for each point of Stamina

GameItemType.Description: Legendary gladiator Black Spike was said to be invincible in the arena, piling up victories and corpses, slaying champions and monsters alike with tireless and relentless determination. These protective joints were rumored to be the siege of his power. Would that make it his groin? Go figure.

GameModifier.Provides: Collect three Black Spike items to inflict Dismantling Stroke- +400% Crushing Blow Attack

GameItemType.Description: Although they can be a pain to put on because of their slippery texture, lubricated greaves allow far greater freedom of movement compared to the classic models.
Wearing these bulky boots let's one enjoy the benefits of a prolonged winter.

Some Ice Elemental is bound to come looking for these sooner or later. Plus the surface is razor-sharp and you already have several cuts to nurse. And yet, despite these minor quibbles, all this crystalline razzle-dazzle fits you to a tee.

GameModifier.Provides: Cutting Surface- Enemies that strike the wearer take 2 damage

GameItemType.Description: Carved from the flayed skin of several Demons, these boots resonate with the telepathic screams of their unwilling providers. Yes, it's true that the raw flesh may still have the occasional spasm but don't let that deter you from sliding your feet into those two lukewarm wombs of comfortable corruption.

GameModifier.Provides: Demonic Ally- Summons an Assassin Demon at the same level as the caster

GameItemType.Description: Lady Sandekka created quite a sensation when she wore these delicate boots to the grand Amarian ball, leaving all the men who glanced at her starry eyed. For women only.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows the wearer to cast Beguile

GameItemType.Description: Put these supple boots on and watch the leagues melt away. Experience enhanced pouncing capabilities, live in the fast lane and bound yourself to the top.

GameModifier.Provides: Leopard Rush Effect- +3 Initiative the first time the unit takes a hit

GameItemType.Description: Highly luxurious, yet morally questionable, these upscale boots will generate envious hisses from onlookers and unfailingly provoke the consternation of pet Ophidians.

GameModifier.Provides: Naja Dancer- +2 Dodge for each point of Stamina

GameItemType.Description: Legendary gladiator Black Spike was said to be invincible in the arena, piling up victories and corpses, slaying champions and monsters alike with tireless and relentless determination. His boots are believed to have crushed many opponents, especially those beneath his contempt who didn't even warrant a second stroke from his weapon.

GameModifier.Provides: +5 Attack for the first turn of combat
+5 Initiative for the first turn of combat
Collect three Black Spike items to inflict Dismantling Stroke- +400% Crushing Blow Attack

GameItemType.Description: The deep purple color of these boots could make you believe that they have been used to crush grapes and make fine wine. But no, the unusual hue comes from the repeated trampling of another kind of sticky substance.

They say stage antics and make believe are essential components of any magical spell. While any self-respecting Mage would vehemently disagree with such an insulting statement, with these boots you'll be able to go from sleight of hand to sleight of foot.
Spongy texture and slimy color to behold, A squishy squashy walk with feet ever cold, A busy buzzin' swarm to twirl and whirl around, A most sticky stride to stay firm on the ground.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows the unit to cast Insect Swarm
Sticky Goo- Enemies that strike the wearer are immobilized for 3 rounds unless they resist

GameItemType.Description: While these boots don't really have teeth, they most certainly have a vicious bite.
If you need to stand firm and hold the line, these boots will root you to the spot.
These boots are mandatory gear if you intend to travel through wetlands or ride the waves.

GameModifier.Provides: Allows the wearer to cast Riptide

GameItemType.Description: This shield lives each battle with its owner on an intimate level, the longer the fighting lasts, the stronger the shield becomes. An inanimate object with a personal interest in dragging things out to achieve its own private nirvana of invulnerability.

GameModifier.Provides: +1 Defense for each point of Stamina
Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: This polished shield will provide a modicum of shelter during magical storms.

GameModifier.Provides: Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: Legendary gladiator Black Spike was said to be invincible in the arena, piling up victories and corpses, slaying champions and monsters alike with tireless and relentless determination. His shield was crafted by a renowned mastersmith who happened to be one of his greatest admirers. So sharp are its spokes that a casual touch might lead to a disabling injury.

GameModifier.Provides: Lacerating Spokes- Enemies that strike the wearer take 2-5 damage
Shield Slam - Knocks victims back a tile and knocks them prone
Collect three Black Spike items to inflict Dismantling Stroke- +400% Crushing Blow Attack

GameItemType.Description: These shields were designed to hunt down Air Shrills and Air Elementals, partially protecting their wearers from electrical attacks.

GameModifier.Provides: Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: So you've found your practice shield. Now you need to locate your wooden sword and your wooden dummy and work on those basic moves some more. Complaints not welcome.

GameModifier.Provides: Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: If you're the unapproachable type, this shield certainly isn't going to improve your social skills. You've got to let people in!

GameModifier.Provides: Rebounder Effect- Striking this unit causes the attacker to be knocked back one tile
Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: Rumored to be fashioned from the metal of a fallen star by the demonic blacksmiths of Tegghan-Turak, these shields were used to devastating effect during the Arcane Wars. Common soldiers would easily disrupt the onslaught of Archmages, leaving them in a stupor long enough to fall to the assault of ordinary weapons.

GameModifier.Provides: Scrambler Effect- Disrupts a spell an enemy unit is casting and causes them to lose their next turn unless they resist
Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: Finely crafted and all for show, this shield is clearly a diplomatic tool and isn't much suited for combat. Do you really want to put marks upon such a pretty work of art?

GameModifier.Provides: Grants the ability to escape (with remaining allies) from battle
Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: The result of a first-rate collaboration between a master smith and a life archmage, this artifact will extend the life of its proprietor far beyond natural limits and even provide some healing in the heat of battle, albeit occasionally and arbitrarily.

GameModifier.Provides: Wayward Deathbane Effect- Has a 25% chance of healing 8 hit points when the wielder hits an enemy
Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: While this heavy shield remains fundamentally a defensive implement, it has also been specifically designed for crushing skulls and shattering bones. Now the brute caged within can finally express itself.

GameModifier.Provides: Bulwark of the Brute Effect- Double Shield Bash damage and knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: It's so big you could probably shield a barn with it. Its golden surface captivates the eye and will break most archers' concentration.

GameModifier.Provides: +10 to the Army's Dodge Against Ranged Attacks
Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: Crafted from the wood of venerable oak trees, these valuable shields grant firmness and fortitude to the wielder and also extend a canopy of solidity to allies.

GameModifier.Provides: Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

GameItemType.Description: Filled with all the paraphernalia and accessories of any self-respecting Master Scout, this backpack will enable its wearer to cover any distance through any terrain.

Here we have a pack full of soldier rations and essential gear to survive in the most extreme conditions. You'll be able to laugh in the face of hostile wilderness and lifeless environments. While this might sound like a seller's pitch, you WILL survive. Hey hey.

GameModifier.Provides: +2 to the Army's Health Regeneration per season

GameItemType.Description: As sturdy as chain mail and yet as light as cloth, the material of this cloak is so soft you could safely wrap a frail and fragile infant in it.
The eyes woven in the material will bestow a mystical double sight to the wearer and open far greater distances to keen observation.
Highly prized and sought out, these cloaks lend several abilities of their original owners, namely speed and deftness.
The hour of the Wolf is at hand and the urge to howl at the moon cannot be denied.

GameModifier.Provides: Summon Lupus - Summons a random level 8 Canine Friend

GameItemType.Description: This cloak may look like a frayed rag barely fit for a beggar but it was made by life-loving hands which sewed in every stitch unbounded generosity, pure kindness and tender affection.

GameModifier.Provides: Mending Hands- Allows the wearer to heal a friendly unit by touch

GameItemType.Description: Myriad matter is the stuff of legends and the general consensus among scholars is that if no material can possibly bind such contradictory properties, ergo it does not exist. The incredible protection this cloak affords will soon become secondary to the pleasure of invalidating erroneous arcane dogma and humiliating many pompous academics.

This revolting thing's squishy surface oozes corrosive digestive fluids and the first thing you'll notice is the sudden disappearance of flying insects from your vicinity. It is in reality a living organism shaped like cloak which awards its willing host a symbiotic relationship drenched in acid. Are you really willing to put that thing on your back?

GameModifier.Provides: -3 Hit Points- the Membrane is slowly eating the host.
Paralyzing Acid- Target enemy suffers -10 Dodge and takes 3-6 damage per turn.
Striking this unit causes the attacker to be sprayed with Paralyzing Acid.
